name: Riven: The Sequel to MYST
description: Prepare to enter a world "torn asunder" by timeless, unresolved conflicts--a world of incomparable beauty, intrigue, and betrayal. Prepare to go to Riven. Journey through vast, awe-inspiring landscapes, where clouds sit nestled in a deep blue sky and the rolling sea waters shimmer from bright morning sunlight.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 / 8 / 10 Processor: 1.8 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Hard Disk Space: 7 GB available HD space Video: DirectX® 9.0c compatible or better Sound: DirectX® 9.0 compatible DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c or greater

reviews.review_text: IMPORTANT: If Riven is crashing for you, make sure to do the following:    1. Start the game 2. Alt+tab out and open up the Task Manager 3. Under the 'Processes' tab, find Riven and right click it 4. Select 'Go to details' on the right click menu 5. Right click Riven again 6. Select 'Set affinity' 7. Set it to run on only one core by unchecking all of the boxes except for one  This should solve the problem of it crashing after a few minutes of play, but you will have to do this every time you start up the game.  Besides that, there's not much else to say. Riven is a great game, there's a reason it's considered a classic.
Beautiful older game that needs more work for fair playability on newer platforms.

This is a review of Riven (the sequel to MYST) Steam version. I say this first because i've already played the game originally in 1997 and certain things had changed for this review (alltough the game essentially is the same from 1997 just compiled to dowload online).  I loved the game when i first played it (almost 20 years ago by now). It was a very interesting sequel to Myst and added many things to the story (in fact, it had a story!) You meet ghen, catherine and again Atrus. There is something going on at least! that is the main thing i guess. The game came out in 5 cd rom discs wich was pretty notable for that time, lots of data and videos. More than 3gb of data for 1997 was a heavy thing. The puzzles are very hard, it is still hard now,but, even if you use a walkthrough it still is rewarding to find out how the world works, how the story of atrus and his family and the linking books unfolds.  The music is the best. Pretty much half of the experience in this game (the first one and this one in fact) is the music. Totally amazing, complements the graphics so well and what happens on screen at times. The graphics by the way, were so amazing in 97 that, still, to this day in some places, they still seem to be made last week. Of course, in general they've became old, but still, this is a 20 years old game!!! Is like watching a movie from 1996 and thinking that the special effects are not so bad...  Now, that was my review from the original game. Now to some things from actual steam/gog version i am reviewing and why i post a negative review.  While i was happy to be able to have a newer build of this classic game, wich i can download from steam and install in modern OS everytime i want. i did encountered certain problems, wich are not acceptable even if it is an old game. First, the game crashes in certain contexts, certain situations. Like for example clicking too fast when moving around (wich of course didn't happen in the original version) While i know that if i don't click too fast i will probably avoid these crashes, still is something that should be taken care of. Specially knowing that the creators and the company of this game (cyan) still exists and should be made aware of this and take care of the problem. Second, in certain situation when saving, your game can crash, during the saving screen... (if you don't use the save buttons). Also, third, and most catastrophic, there is a scene in game, where you have to turn on a light in a passage. When you do that, and you turn around, either the game crashes or takes you to a previous screen.... this is unavoidable. There is anyway, a way to continue through the passage after turning on the light (without crashing) so i finished the game luckily, but i already knew what to do there, i don't know what i could have done if it were my first time playing it, and didn't knew what to do there. This is something that happens at least in a win 7 64 environment and should be fixed, if not they are essentialy selling you a broken game. This is why i will not recommend this game, at least this version on steam and gog (the same). It is a shame, there was an interesting game...somewhere, there, but now it is too old, and its broken in someplaces so... (you could say that, ironically, the game, the same as the fifth age in riven, have become full of fissures everywhere....how sad...)

Because its current form is quite aged, Riven requires an open mind to enjoy.  Get this game because: puzzles (which are near perfectly built into environment and story); story; the most beautiful animated slideshow adventure there is.  Cons: 1997 display resolution; having to wait ~20sec for some journal pages to load (old, sequential scripting and filing); having to blip from the game to learn basic D'ni counting (which is base-25)  Btw, the Starry Expanse Project aims to remake this game in Unreal Engine 4.  Easy fix to bug: Before you get to the Moeity age called Tay, after activating the light at the end of the secret prison tunnel, repeat the path from the gallows UNTIL YOU FIRST SEE THE WATER, THEN TURN AROUND and continue lighting the tunnel, and finishing the game.  This brief review is biased because I played this game as an infant. I can play the entire thing now within three hours because I am familiar with the Myst / D'ni fictional world.

Fantastic adventure game ! Can be very challenging, hard sometimes, but it's beautiful and the story is nothing else than amazing ! (Since the game is old, you may need some fixing, like setting riven.exe in Windows XP SP2 or Windows 98 Compatibility mode in Properties)

Riven will always be one of my favourite games. Unfortunately my original cd version of it refused to install ( win-7 64bit ). But found it on steam and took the plunge fingers crossed that it would work on my system. And with the valuable fix and workaround posts i read, it now works and runs flawlessly.! So pleased. :) Definately worth afew bucks for a still beautiful game.!

You are trapped in the world of Riven and must explore and interact with objects to find a way to escape. You are not alone in this world, and you are not the only prisoner. There is no combat, there is no time limit or urgency, and there is no way to die in error. There are alternate endings.  This is an exploration puzzle game, and if you finish without any help you're a genius. The game had gorgeous graphics and animations for its time, but if you play it in its unstretched, native resolution now it's about the size of a 5x7 photo. Still, that didn't stop me from being able to complete the game and puzzles (with some help) and it still looks good. What little music the game has is great too, but most is ambient.  What makes the game so difficult is a combination of trial and error, clues being very cryptic or difficult to decipher, and many objects you interact with that feel like they may be related to solving a puzzle aren't. Crashed on me several times in Windows 7.

A good, interesting game. Though it lacks the diveristy and depth of the oraginal, In having only one real 'Age'. It still has the same sense of MYSTery and adventure. If you are a fan or the first game I would recommend this.

While Myst was a bit claustrophobic in its small island worlds, Riven drops you into an island archipelago.   This is not an easy game, and I highly recomend having a little notebook to take notes, if only to decipher the alien numerals. Avoid online walkthrus if at all possible, the real joy of this game is figuiring it all out for yourself... eventually...

Point and Clinking interface aside, this game is masterful. But then, the Myst series has always been one for puzzle designs that are intuitively simple in solution. Riven is the best game of the five Myst games available.

I had never played the Myst games but always heard great things. I installed Riven and was instantly in love with the old style graphics and play. It was beautiful and the music was great, and the whole thing was perfectly atmospheric and immersive. I was really excited to spend some time with it until it crashed the first time.  I restarted thinking it was just a fluke, but it happened again, and kept happening. I've tried disabling desktop comp, visual themes, ran in compatibility mode, set the cpu core affinity in launch options, but it still crashes usually after a few minutes of play.  Reading through the forums it seems this is a very common problem. I honestly think I would love this game if I could play it.
As much as i love this game and wish i could bask in its awesome-ness, the steam port will not save, and for this single reason i cannot recommend this amazing, classic game :(
